wikipedia_page.main: Robert Tucker (1832–1905) was an English mathematician, who was secretary of the London Mathematical Society for more than 30 years.

response: * 1882. Mathematical Papers, edited by Robert Tucker, with an introduction by Henry J. S. Smith.Clifford, William K. 1882. Mathematical Papers, edited by R. Tucker, introduction by H. J. S. Smith. London: MacMillan and Co. – via Internet Archive.
* Robert Tucker (boat designer) (died 1998), British sailor and boat designer
* Robert Tucker (horse trainer) (1857–1910), Kentucky Derby winning trainer
* Robert Tucker (burgess 1753) (died 1767), member of the House of Burgesses, Virginia

Born in London, he began his secondary studies at the University College School, under Robert Tucker. After one year at University College of London Bennett obtained a scholarship at St. John's College, Cambridge where he graduated in 1890 as Senior Wrangler. However the best grade in the Mathematical Tripos of that year was for Philippa Fawcett but she was not included in the list for his gender.
